sentences: Pikk, sihvakas, sale, habras, nõtke kehaga peenikeste säärtega prinkide rindadega ovaalse näoga siniste silmadega naine.
Poeg kavatseb naist võtta, hakkab naist võtma.
Tüdrukult kui tui, naiselt kui nui.
context: The Estonian word 'naine' has two main meanings: 1) an adult female person or woman in general, and 2) a wife when referring to someone's spouse. It can be used with various adjectives to describe different types of women (young, mature, old, beautiful, intelligent, etc.) and appears in numerous compound words specifying the type or occupation of the woman. The word follows specific declension patterns in Estonian grammar with different endings for cases like nominative, genitive, partitive, illative, etc.
